body:
# Auto Pull Request Review from LlamaPReview

## Large PR Notification

Dear contributor,

Thank you for your substantial contribution to this project. LlamaPReview has detected that this Pull Request contains a large volume of changes, which exceeds our current processing capacity.

### Details:
- PR and related contents total size: Approximately 126,880 characters
- Current limit: 50,000 characters

### Next steps:
1. Consider breaking this PR into smaller, more focused changes if possible.
2. For manual review, please reach out to your team members or maintainers.

We appreciate your understanding and commitment to improving this project. Your contributions are valuable, and we want to ensure they receive the attention they deserve.

LlamaPReview is continuously evolving to better serve the community. Share your thoughts on handling large PRs in our [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/JetXu-LLM/LlamaPReview-site/discussions) - your feedback helps us improve and expand our capabilities.

If you have any questions or need assistance, our community and support team are here to help.

Best regards,
LlamaPReview Team

**Actionable comments posted: 3**
🔭 Outside diff range comments (2)
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Details/Components/MonitorHeader/index.jsx (1)
Line range hint `15-15`: **Yo dawg, that console.log needs to bounce! 🚫** Remove this debug statement before it ships to production. ```diff - console.log(shouldRender); ```
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/Components/Card/index.jsx (1)
Line range hint `73-73`: **Mom's spaghetti time! Let's split this component! 🍝** These TODOs are calling for component separation, and they're right! This component is doing too much: - CustomToolTip could be its own component - PagespeedAreaChart should be separated - Utils should be moved to a dedicated folder This refactoring would improve maintainability and align with the PR's goals. Would you like me to help create a new PR to handle this separation of concerns? Also applies to: 144-144, 187-187
🧹 Nitpick comments (14)
Client/src/Routes/index.jsx (1)
`21-25`: **Hold up, we got a commented import line chillin' here! 👀** There's a commented-out import statement that should be removed to keep the codebase clean: ```diff - // import PageSpeed from "../Pages/PageSpeed"; ```
Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/index.jsx (1)
`159-164`: **Consider extracting color threshold logic into a utility function.** The color threshold logic for uptime percentage could be moved to a utility function for reusability and maintainability. ```diff +const getUptimeColor = (theme, percentage) => { + if (percentage < 0.25) return theme.palette.error.main; + if (percentage < 0.5) return theme.palette.warning.main; + return theme.palette.success.main; +}; -const percentageColor = - monitor.uptimePercentage < 0.25 - ? theme.palette.error.main - : monitor.uptimePercentage < 0.5 - ? theme.palette.warning.main - : theme.palette.success.main; +const percentageColor = getUptimeColor(theme, monitor.uptimePercentage); ```
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Details/index.jsx (1)
Line range hint `1-400`: **Consider breaking down this large component into smaller, focused components.** The PageSpeedDetails component is quite large and handles multiple responsibilities. Consider extracting the following into separate components: - Performance metrics section - Score history section - Status information section This would improve maintainability and make the code easier to test.
Client/src/Components/CreateMonitorHeader/skeleton.jsx (1)
`11-14`: **Yo dawg, let's make this skeleton more responsive!** Instead of fixed pixel values, consider using relative units or theme-based spacing for better responsiveness across different screen sizes. ```diff ```
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/Components/MonitorGrid/index.jsx (2)
`1-2`: **Yo, what's up with that Grid import, fam?** You're importing both `Grid` and `Grid2` but only using `Grid`. Let's clean this up. ```diff -import { Grid, Grid2 } from "@mui/material"; +import { Grid } from "@mui/material"; ``` --- `8-11`: **That spacing's bigger than mom's spaghetti! 🍝** A spacing value of 12 is unusually large (96px). Consider using a smaller value like 2 or 3 for better visual density. ```diff ```
Client/src/Components/MonitorCountHeader/skeleton.jsx (1)
`4-24`: **Let's make this component fresh like mom's spaghetti! 🔥** Consider memoizing the component since it's purely presentational. ```diff +import { memo } from 'react'; import { Stack, Skeleton } from "@mui/material"; import { useTheme } from "@emotion/react"; -const SkeletonLayout = () => { +const SkeletonLayout = memo(() => { const theme = useTheme(); return ( ); -}; +}); + +SkeletonLayout.displayName = 'SkeletonLayout'; ```
Client/src/Components/CreateMonitorHeader/index.jsx (1)
`16-22`: **That callback's making me nervous, yo! 🤔** Memoize the navigation callback to prevent unnecessary re-renders. ```diff +const handleClick = useCallback(() => navigate(path), [navigate, path]);
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/Hooks/useMonitorsFetch.jsx (1)
`29-33`: **Error handling could use some love!** The error handling is basic and only shows the error message. Consider: 1. Adding error state management 2. Implementing retry logic for transient failures ```diff -catch (error) { - createToast({ - body: error.message, - }); +catch (error) { + const isTransient = error.status >= 500; + createToast({ + body: error.message, + type: isTransient ? 'warning' : 'error', + }); + if (isTransient) { + // Implement retry logic + } ```
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/index.jsx (1)
`16-16`: **Yo dawg, that BREADCRUMBS constant is looking sus!** The path in BREADCRUMBS is lowercase but the component name is PascalCase. Let's maintain consistency. ```diff -const BREADCRUMBS = [{ name: `pagespeed`, path: "/pagespeed" }]; +const BREADCRUMBS = [{ name: `PageSpeed`, path: "/pagespeed" }]; ```
Client/src/Components/Fallback/index.jsx (1)
`79-79`: **That TODO comment is giving me anxiety!** The TODO comment indicates missing functionality for non-admin users. This should be addressed or tracked. Would you like me to help implement the non-admin fallback UI or create an issue to track this?
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Monitors/Components/UptimeDataTable/index.jsx (1)
`219-231`: **Ayy, this MonitorCountHeader implementation is fire! 🔥** Clean implementation with proper loading state handling. One small suggestion to make it even better: Consider extracting the search component configuration into a separate constant to improve readability: ```diff + const searchConfig = { + monitorsAreLoading, + monitors, + onSearchChange: setSearch, + setIsSearching, + }; - + ```
Client/src/Components/MonitorCountHeader/index.jsx (2)
`8-30`: **Yo dawg, this component's structure is tight, but let's make it bulletproof! 💪** A few suggestions to level up this implementation: ```diff const MonitorCountHeader = ({ shouldRender = true, + monitorCount = 0, + heading = '', + sx = {}, children, }) => { const theme = useTheme(); if (!shouldRender) return ; return ( {heading} - + {children} ); }; ``` --- `32-38`: **Let's make these PropTypes as solid as mom's spaghetti! 🍝** Some props should be marked as required since they're essential for the component to function properly: ```diff MonitorCountHeader.propTypes = { shouldRender: PropTypes.bool, - monitorCount: PropTypes.number, - heading: PropTypes.string, + monitorCount: PropTypes.number.isRequired, + heading: PropTypes.string.isRequired, children: PropTypes.node, sx: PropTypes.object, }; ```
📜 Review details **Configuration used: .coderabbit.yaml** **Review profile: CHILL** **Plan: Pro**
📥 Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between f00e7e668da56420d50f967b589352c74dbb6e37 and 5880993565b04a9a91e63b3bb878ed0e34540377.
📒 Files selected for processing (26) * `Client/src/Components/BasicTable/index.jsx` (0 hunks) * `Client/src/Components/CreateMonitorHeader/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Components/CreateMonitorHeader/skeleton.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Components/Fallback/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Components/MonitorCountHeader/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Components/MonitorCountHeader/skeleton.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Components/StatBox/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/Create/Components/CustomThreshold/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/Create/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/Details/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/index.jsx` (3 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Configure/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Details/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/Components/Card/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/Components/MonitorGrid/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/Hooks/useMonitorsFetch.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/index.css` (0 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/index.jsx` (0 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/skeleton.jsx` (0 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Details/Components/MonitorHeader/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Details/Components/StatusBoxes/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Monitors/Components/StatusBoxes/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Monitors/Components/UptimeDataTable/index.jsx` (2 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Monitors/index.jsx` (2 hunks) * `Client/src/Routes/index.jsx` (5 hunks)
💤 Files with no reviewable changes (4) * Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/index.css * Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/skeleton.jsx * Client/src/Components/BasicTable/index.jsx * Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/index.jsx
✅ Files skipped from review due to trivial changes (4) * Client/src/Components/StatBox/index.jsx * Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/Create/index.jsx * Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Configure/index.jsx * Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/Create/Components/CustomThreshold/index.jsx
⏰ Context from checks skipped due to timeout of 90000ms (1) * GitHub Check: Analyze (javascript-typescript)
🔇 Additional comments (18)
Client/src/Routes/index.jsx (3) `6-12`: **Yo dawg, these Auth imports are looking fresh! 🔥** The consistent "Auth" prefix naming convention makes the authentication components more organized and easier to track. This aligns perfectly with the standardization goals mentioned in the PR objectives. --- `67-77`: **These route updates are straight fire! 🚀** The route elements have been updated to use the new component names consistently: - `UptimeCreate` for monitor creation - `UptimeConfigure` for configuration - `PageSpeedCreate` for PageSpeed creation - `InfrastructureCreate` for infrastructure creation This improves code maintainability by following a consistent naming pattern across different monitor types. Also applies to: 83-85, 99-101 --- Line range hint `146-176`: **Auth routes got that new drip! 💧** The authentication routes have been updated to use the new `Auth`-prefixed components consistently. This change maintains the standardization across the authentication flow: - Login - Registration (including token-based) - Password management (forgot, reset, confirm) The routing logic remains unchanged while improving component organization.
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Monitors/Components/StatusBoxes/index.jsx (1) `33-33`: **Yo, this prop type change is fire! 🔥** Making `monitorsSummary` optional with proper fallbacks is a solid defensive programming practice. The component already handles undefined cases gracefully with nullish coalescing operators.
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Details/Components/MonitorHeader/index.jsx (1) `5-5`: **Import path update looking clean! ✨** The new import path aligns with the standardization goals of the PR.
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Details/Components/StatusBoxes/index.jsx (1) `7-7`: **This import path update is straight fire! 🔥** The new path structure is more organized and consistent with other components. Keep that standardization coming!
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/Components/Card/index.jsx (1) `2-4`: **Import paths looking clean and organized! ✨** The standardized import paths improve code organization and maintainability. Also applies to: 10-13
Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/index.jsx (1) `5-5`: **LGTM! Import path changes align with standardization goals.** The updated import paths from `Home` to `Monitors` directory reflect better organization and standardization. Also applies to: 20-20
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Details/index.jsx (1) `22-22`: **LGTM! Import path change aligns with standardization.** The updated import path from `Home` to `Monitors` directory maintains consistency with the project's reorganization.
Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/Details/index.jsx (2) `11-11`: **LGTM! Import path change aligns with standardization.** The updated import path from `Home` to `Monitors` directory maintains consistency with the project's reorganization. --- Line range hint `577-579`: **Address FE team questions in comments.** There are several questions marked with "FE team HELP!" that need attention: ```javascript // FE team HELP! Possibly no longer needed? // FE team HELP! Better way to do this? ``` Let's help track down these questions:
Client/src/Components/CreateMonitorHeader/index.jsx (1) `18-18`: **Hold up, is that color prop legit? 🎨** Verify that "accent" is a valid color in your MUI theme configuration.
✅ Verification successful **Yo, that "accent" color is totally legit! 💯** The color prop is properly configured in the theme with `blueBlueWave` (#1570EF) as the base color, including hover states and contrast text definitions. Keep it rollin'!
🏁 Scripts executed The following scripts were executed for the analysis: Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Search for theme configuration files echo "Searching for MUI theme configuration..." rg -l "createTheme|ThemeProvider" --type js --type jsx --type ts --type tsx # Search for "accent" color definition echo "Checking for 'accent' color definition..." rg "accent.*:|palette.*accent" --type js --type jsx --type ts --type tsx ``` Length of output: 398 --- Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Search for theme configuration and color definitions echo "Searching for MUI theme configuration..." rg -t js -t tsx -t ts "createTheme|ThemeProvider" echo "\nChecking for 'accent' color definitions or usage..." rg -t js -t tsx -t ts "accent.*:|palette.*accent|color=['\"]accent['\"]" -A 2 -B 2 echo "\nChecking for Button components with color prop..." rg -t js -t tsx -t ts "Button.*color=" -A 1 -B 1 ``` Length of output: 602 --- Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Use find and grep instead of rg for more basic searching echo "Searching for theme-related files..." find . -type f -name "*.js" -o -name "*.jsx" | xargs grep -l "createTheme\|ThemeProvider" 2>/dev/null echo "\nSearching for accent color usage..." find . -type f -name "*.js" -o -name "*.jsx" | xargs grep -l "color.*accent" 2>/dev/null echo "\nLooking at the specific component file..." cat Client/src/Components/CreateMonitorHeader/index.jsx 2>/dev/null ``` Length of output: 2932 --- Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash echo "Checking theme files content..." echo "\nGlobal theme:" cat ./Client/src/Utils/Theme/globalTheme.js echo "\nLight theme:" cat ./Client/src/Utils/Theme/lightTheme.js echo "\nDark theme:" cat ./Client/src/Utils/Theme/darkTheme.js ``` Length of output: 8954 --- Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash echo "Checking color constants..." cat ./Client/src/Utils/Theme/constants.js ``` Length of output: 5537
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/Hooks/useMonitorsFetch.jsx (2) `14-24`: **Yo, these hardcoded parameters need some explanation!** The network request includes several hardcoded parameters that could use some documentation or extraction into constants: - `limit: 10` - `types: ["pagespeed"]` - `page: null` - `rowsPerPage: null` Let's check if these parameters are used consistently across the codebase:
✅ Verification successful **Yo, these parameters are actually legit! 🎯** The hardcoded values are intentionally set for the PageSpeed monitoring view, following a consistent pattern across the codebase where each view customizes these parameters for its specific needs. The server properly validates all these values.
🏁 Scripts executed The following scripts were executed for the analysis: Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Search for similar network requests to compare parameter usage rg -A 5 'getMonitorsByTeamId' ``` Length of output: 18519
--- `25-28`: **That optional chaining is making me nervous, fam!** The deep optional chaining `res?.data?.data?.filteredMonitors` suggests uncertainty about the API response structure. Consider adding type definitions or documentation for the expected response shape. Let's verify the API response structure:
Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/Monitors/index.jsx (1) `58-61`: **That size prop is looking mighty lonely without documentation!** The `size={6}` prop on MonitorGrid needs explanation. Is this columns, items per row, or something else? Let's check the MonitorGrid component's prop types:
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Monitors/index.jsx (2) `103-113`: **This conditional rendering is straight fire! 🔥** The Fallback component implementation looks clean and follows best practices. The checks array with a single item is appropriate for this use case. --- `121-125`: **CreateMonitorHeader props looking clean!** The component props are well-structured and follow a consistent pattern with other similar components in the codebase.
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Monitors/Components/UptimeDataTable/index.jsx (1) `15-17`: **Yo, these imports are clean and organized! 🎯** The separation of component imports and the addition of new components aligns perfectly with the refactoring goals.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: summarize by coderabbit.ai -->


<!-- walkthrough_start -->

## Walkthrough

This pull request represents a significant refactoring of the client-side application, focusing on restructuring components, reorganizing file paths, and introducing new modular components across multiple sections of the application. The changes primarily involve moving utility hooks, creating new components for monitoring interfaces, and updating import paths to reflect a more organized project structure. Key areas of modification include PageSpeed, Uptime, and Infrastructure monitoring pages, with an emphasis on improving component modularity and user interface consistency.

## Changes

| File Path | Change Summary |
|-----------|----------------|
| `Client/src/Components/` | Added new components: `CreateMonitorHeader`, `MonitorCountHeader`, `SkeletonLayout` |
| `Client/src/Pages/PageSpeed/` | Completely restructured monitoring page, removed old implementation, introduced new `Monitors/index.jsx` with improved component structure |
| `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/` | Updated multiple components with new import paths, modified utility hook imports |
| `Client/src/Routes/index.jsx` | Renamed and reorganized route components, updated import statements |

## Suggested Reviewers

- mertssmnoglu

## Possibly Related PRs

- #1632: Refactor of Uptime home page components
- #1648: Refactoring of Uptime Details components

The changes demonstrate a comprehensive effort to improve code organization, component modularity, and maintain a consistent approach to UI development across different monitoring sections of the application.

<!-- walkthrough_end -->

<details>
<summary>🪧 Tips</summary>

### Chat

There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai):

> ‼️ **IMPORTANT**
> Auto-reply has been disabled for this repository in the CodeRabbit settings. The CodeRabbit bot will not respond to your replies unless it is explicitly tagged.
- Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai generate unit testing code for this file.`
  -	`@coderabbitai modularize this function.`
- PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.`
  - `@coderabbitai read src/utils.ts and generate unit testing code.`
  - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.`
  - `@coderabbitai help me debug CodeRabbit configuration file.`

Note: Be mindful of the bot's finite context window. It's strongly recommended to break down tasks such as reading entire modules into smaller chunks. For a focused discussion, use review comments to chat about specific files and their changes, instead of using the PR comments.

### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR comments)

- `@coderabbitai pause` to pause the reviews on a PR.
- `@coderabbitai resume` to resume the paused reviews.
- `@coderabbitai review` to trigger an incremental review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai full review` to do a full review from scratch and review all the files again.
- `@coderabbitai summary` to regenerate the summary of the PR.
- `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to [generate docstrings](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/finishing-touches/docstrings) for this PR. ([Beta](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/early-access#beta))
- `@coderabbitai resolve` resolve all the CodeRabbit review comments.
- `@coderabbitai configuration` to show the current CodeRabbit configuration for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai help` to get help.

### Other keywords and placeholders

- Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
- Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description.
- Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically.

### Documentation and Community

- Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit.
- Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback.
- Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.

</details>

<!-- tips_end -->
